originalText.text: Knead love is a gluten-free godsend. I love getting their brownies, cinnamon raisin bread and everything bagels.  Today I added some Rebel banana peanut chip ice cream after warming up the brownie on 275 for a few minutes.

text.text: Knead love is a gluten-free godsend. I love getting their brownies, cinnamon raisin bread and everything bagels.  Today I added some Rebel banana peanut chip ice cream after warming up the brownie on 275 for a few minutes.

originalText.text: Love everything from Knead Love Bakery - not only is all of the food delicious (hand pies, cookies, crackers, breads), but the staff has such positive energy, even when working at outdoor farmers markets in NYC in December. I also love how they work with other farmer's market vendors and support each other. Highly recommend!

text.text: Love everything from Knead Love Bakery - not only is all of the food delicious (hand pies, cookies, crackers, breads), but the staff has such positive energy, even when working at outdoor farmers markets in NYC in December. I also love how they work with other farmer's market vendors and support each other. Highly recommend!

originalText.text: Knead Love Bakery is at the Union Square Greenmarket on Wednesday, and bakes and sells gluten-free, natural sourdough breads and treats with whole grains. locally sourced with no additives or preservatives, with very high quality and nutritious and flavorful ingredients.  If you like chocolate, I'd recommend the chocolate brownie which is mostly made with almond butter and dark chocolate from local craft chocolate makers such as Brooklyn based Raaka without the common soy lecithin, and with local maple syrup rather than added refined sugar.  Many baked goods feature whole grain gluten-free buckwheat flour as well as oat flour which are very healthy.  Some of the baked goods feature local fruits and berries.  The bagels are all sourdough and dense with whole grains and seeds.

text.text: Knead Love Bakery is at the Union Square Greenmarket on Wednesday, and bakes and sells gluten-free, natural sourdough breads and treats with whole grains. locally sourced with no additives or preservatives, with very high quality and nutritious and flavorful ingredients.  If you like chocolate, I'd recommend the chocolate brownie which is mostly made with almond butter and dark chocolate from local craft chocolate makers such as Brooklyn based Raaka without the common soy lecithin, and with local maple syrup rather than added refined sugar.  Many baked goods feature whole grain gluten-free buckwheat flour as well as oat flour which are very healthy.  Some of the baked goods feature local fruits and berries.  The bagels are all sourdough and dense with whole grains and seeds.

originalText.text: This is my favorite gluten free bakery in NYC!  They are my go to on Wednesdays when I go to the Farmers Market in Union Square.  My favorites are the cinny buns and chocolate chip cookies.  But, I also like their smores cookies and crackers.  Their crackers have a nice savory taste and good crunch.  Since I have a nut sensitivity I am glad that some of their products are nut free as well.   Plus, the owner/baker exudes so much warmth.  I love supporting small business and when they are nice people with great products it is a no brainer  :).

originalText.text: Tried to go here 3 times. The first two times it was closed. The third time I was completely ignored by two different people manning the counter. There was hardly any selection. Scones, one kind of doughnut and a single type of cookie. They all looked good but hard to know when no one will even acknowledge that you've been standing at the counter much less let you order. Oh well.
